name: Anonymous
com:
/vm/ is a place to discuss all types of multiplayer games, whether on console, handheld, or PC, co-op or competitive, online or local.

Does this mean discussion of multiplayer games is banned on other video game boards? No! /vm/ is just a separate board specifically focused on multiplayer games where discussions about your favorite games can thrive.

Please familiarize yourself with the rules and remember to use the spoiler function where appropriate!

Please note that, like /v/, "Generals"—long-term, one-after-the-other, recurring threads about a specific game are not permitted on /vm/. Such threads belong on >>>/vg/

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
Multiplayer games includes (but is not limited to) Fighting games, First-person shooters, MMOs, Racing games, Sports games, Board & Card games, Party games, and any other genre of game that requires two or more players. Please post threads about single player games on an appropriate board.

Looking for players? Post a LFP thread. Advertising your game servers is allowed and encouraged! Just don't ask for money or spam the board.

Consider using Hamachi, ZeroTier One, or GameRanger for playing old-school LAN games.

>>776757
Yes, but usually your supposed to have a unique set of stats and abilities that give you strengths and weaknesses which forces you to approach problems in different ways. Most games that call themselves RPGs don't actually take this into account and usually you can just out grind your way out of any problem.

Early MMOs actually were one of the few styles of RPGs where, sure, you did just grind for hours to get stronger and overpower problems you had, but at the same time your character had different ways to approaching problems, and when you combined them with other players, you could overcome technically anything.

Now everything is rigidly balanced around the concept of a 'trinity', where you pick your favorite flavor of 3 roles and do the exact same thing as everyone else, tanks are invincible and holds threat, DPS just do damage, and healers heal, ironically this is more imbalanced then niche based characters and RPG stats and problem solving because characters with the most front loaded outputs tend to be favored in these scenarios, like no one cares that a warlock can pull 4-5 mobs and not die due to high stamina and life steal, and kill them slowly, but efficiently as someone killing 5 mobs 1 at a time, the guy who used to kill 5 mobs 1 at a time efficiently now just AOEs mobs at the same rate as he used to 1v1 them.

SRB2 Kart is a mod of a mod based on the Doom Legacy engine, turning the game engine into a kart racer akin to Super Mario Kart. It's a very lightweight game and runs on most all PCs. Use this thread to start netgames, join other anons, give help/tips, spritework, modding, feedback, etc.

>How to Play (v1.3)
https://github.com/STJr/Kart-Public/releases/tag/v1.3
1. Download the game below in 'Full Install (...)'
>Compiling on Linux
https://wiki.srb2.org/wiki/Source_code_compiling/Makefiles#Compiling_on_Linux
2. Unzip contents into a separate folder
3. Load up 'srb2kart.exe'
4. That's it

>Do we have a /v/ server?!
Yes! We're now running on a new modified EXE that allows for more characters and up to 32 racers. First, download it here:
https://mega.nz/file/ncpRjRYZ#yoVkgXmKNUjdh__jHpmUGgh30J7jlj6RIS8XjbTXKeE (both 32 and 64 bit)

or compile it here:
https://gitlab.com/c3851/srb-2-k-cep
Then, you need to download the add-ons and mods (characters, maps, and racing mods). Get them here:
https://mega.nz/folder/PVgWAB7Y#Fo7sB6yvvek3A9MoSzoCOQ (new addons for updates are in the server anon folder)

Valheim's progression is too heavily tipped towards "once you've done a thing once you never need to do it again" and that goes for bosses but also finding a lot of materials and shit. Like the length of the content is already a problem but even a bigger one is the breadth of the content. Each biome has fuckall to do. One visit to one version of said biome is almost always enough with a couple exceptions. There needs to be a lot more variety in the content within each biome so that you won't finding all that there is to do in Dark Forest in every single Dark Forest. They should also consider some sort of system that bumps up the difficulty of the early biomes as they get further from the center. Draugr villages in meadows are sort of this already but there needs to be more shit like that.

There's going to be subclasses, but god knows when they're gonna come. I'm going to guess at least not for another 3 or 4 months. They gotta figure out endgame and how to make a good one to keep players playing. Especially if they're going the FOMO monetization route. That being said, if you look at the classes they're designed like the following

Veteran : Sharpshooter
Ogryn : Skullbreaker
Psyker : Psykinetic
Zealot : Preacher

So the Vet, Ogryn, Psyker, and Zealot are the main while the Sharpshooter/Skull/Psyk/Preach are the subclasses. Guess the trick to theorizing possabilities would be asking ok what can a imperial guard Veteran specialize in. Or an Ogryn. Or a Zealot. Or a Psyker. Some guess I have

Veteran - Sergent (dual wielding with a sword/pistol), some kind of medic/support focused one, a heavy weapons one, and potentially a stealthy close quarters one. Don't think well get a sniper as the sharpshooter is kind of supposed to be that.

Ogryn - I think the next ones may be focused on ranged damage. Hard to say if this will be multiple ones. Like maybe there will be one that is "smaller" arms like boltgun type of sizes. Then you'll have more heavy weapons focused subclass.

Psyker - This one will be hard to say in terms of gear. But in terms of powers, there's an abundance of uses. I imagine it will be focused around the disciplines. Biomancy (healer or tank maybe). Divination (some kind of ranged or melee assassin/glass canon). Pyromancy (fire dps, maybe horde focused). And telepathy (some kind of CC focused one?)

Zealot - Since they already went with preacher, I'm going to guess they'll follow the lore with the other ranks. Confessor, Missionary, Maybe confessor sergeant. Perhaps even a crusader that's focused on sword/shield.

I have a feeling they'll all follow the same designs in terms of what is their focus. Tankiness, Support, Melee DPS, Range DPS, AoE/Multitarget or Single target.

com:
Welcome to /VM/abinogi. Mabinogi is a fun, once popular little old school Korean MMO from 2004 based around Celtic mythology with many different features. Your character can age, rebirth, eat food and gain weight, play and custom make music, and so much more. You can be anything and do anything all at once with no downsides. From non combat related skills like cooking, tailoring, blacksmithing, trading goods in a commerce, carpentry, etc. to different styles of combat like melee, magic, ninja, archery, puppetry, etc. all on 1 character. Although graphics and gameplay is still a bit dated, even after 14 years the game is still rich in content such as fashion contests, cooking contest, jousting, playing in or viewing large concerts, training pets, and so on and continues to be Nexon's most generous game.

>>How to connect
From wii.guide/wiimmfi:
>Wii (no homebrew)
1. Insert your game disc.
2. Go into your internet connection settings and set the DNS server of your console to 95.217.77.151.
3. Go to the WC24 contract information (third button after clicking on “Internet” in the settings).
4. Confirm that you do want to use WC24 and the shop channel
5. The Wiimmfi patcher page should show up. If it doesn’t, and you still see the default license agreement, your router might not be compatible with this method.
6. Wait for about 1 minute and 30 seconds for the patcher to load
The game should now start with the Wiimmfi patch included
>Nintendo DS
You'll need a Wi-Fi network with WEP or no security
1. Go in the Nintendo DS Wi-Fi settings. This can be accessed inside the game you want to play online with.
2. Set up a connection.
3. Type in 164.132.44.106 as the primary DNS.
4. Type in 1.1.1.1 as the secondary DNS (if it gives you problems, try 8.8.8.8).
5. Save your connection settings and perform a connection test. If it’s successful, then you’re ready to play.

Even those who bitch on twitter about how ableist hadoken inputs are or whatever copes they spout.
The dream for devs is to create a game where the audience think the game is both hardc0re and where any beginner moron masher thinks he is hot shit even when its not true at all. Tekken pulls that off. You can literally roll your face on your buttons and the characters will shit out some high/low strings that the other shitter player cant handle. Then the other shitter player does the same and both think they are playing "good ass tekken©" like their favorite ecelebs. They are not, but they cant tell because the characters do some cool looking shit on the screen and they feel accomplished. Its farcical but it works. For 2D fighters this is inherently harder to pull off because of their core design, but I remember to this day that way back in SF2 days many casuals liked to pick a character like Honda or Blanka and just mash hands/electricity. Hardly a tournament winning strategy but something that made shitters feel good when they played with friends on the couch. The game managed to incorporate things like this without the feeling of a mastermind designer belittling you.

On top of that Fantasy Strike looks like shit, feels like shit and tries to solve problems nobody ever saw as problems, like turning health bars into health points or removing fucking lows. Imagine actually releasing a game more bare bones than SF2 30 years ago, back when everybody did just fine doing j.hk into sweep against each other over and over again.
Fuck that hack.

sub: Would people play an MMO game where you can't resurrect your character?
com:
Imagine a realistic post apocalyptic horror MMO where people live in shelters underground. In daylight the surface is somewhat liveable with a few zombies walking around. But at night lovecraftian horrors come out and start hunting.
You can level up, develop skills, collect components, and manufacture tools, weapons and armor.
But the most important part: You only have one life. If you die you have to start from level 1 again.
In order it to work the game has to have other aspects to enjoy beyond farming.
But it would be super scary if death has actual stake. In modern games death means nothing and I think it's super boring.
But maybe it is incompatible with the modern gaming culture what built on casual gaming and fast and easy satisfaction.
What is your opinion?

Compared to LoL, it has much less of an issue with about the RNG of matchups, because 80% of the game is skill and most fights feel like the better player won. Also, the game is less "class-based" than MMOs because 50% of the combat is the same non-hero/class -based melee mechanics. Simple heroes has made it possible to balance the game in a way where characters don't incredibly hard counter each other. However, in MMOs, there are so many skills that it's impossible to balance it in a way where everyone has fair chance by playing in their unique playstyle.

The flipside of skill-based gameplay is that then your build, actions and plans matter less, which could be a problem in MMO. I would imagine the goal of an MMO is to have that kind of power fantasy of being able to prepare for challenges in your own way.

I haven't played a proper MMO so I don't know how skill-based gameplay fits in MMOs, or what PvP in an MMO even is for, other than abusing power for some sort of profit or sadism, which is both good and bad. Souls PvP has some skill but also matchups, for me the ultimate motivation is making a build that counters my most hated build. While it's just exchanging advantage to another disadvantage, I think this can feel meaningful, and you can definitely balance a game so that one thing is not best against everything.

The truth is that you simply can't have control and power when it's against other players. It's either more about matchups, more about skill, or RNG and circumstances. When you play chess, you have "control" over your actions, but you still don't have control over mistakes you make and thoughts you didn't think. Somebody always loses in PvP. You can only get consistent power fantasy of winning in PvE that's designed to be won, and that's mental masturbation then.

name: /bng/ - BallisticNG Saturday races
com:
>What is this game?
BallisticNG is a PC anti-gravity racing game available on Steam for $8, based mostly on Wip3out, with optional mechanics from the newer Wipeout games.
If you like going fast, good tunes, and good fun, this game is for you.

>How do I join?
Get the game (Grab the Outer Reaches DLC for $3 if you want, though not required as we mostly play custom tracks anyway).
Download and install the track pack (instructions in the pastebin).
Launch the game, go to Multiplayer, and join what is most likely the only public Steam lobby online. If we are playing in an IP lobby (piratefag friendly) it will be designated at the end of this post or within the thread.

Everything else you need will be here:
https://pastebin.com/tHrNfZdv
Make sure you get the Trackpack
Newest Trackpack (last updated: 2022/09/22):
https://mega.nz/file/m4gHVJQJ#_ay4DAvFLsQ4hlHzDrsZp_9uGjyyVQucGb4HSSdTA_I
Newest Minipack, get this if you're just updating your track pack:
https://mega.nz/file/el4jFCzT#-0lH7G1ENVLM-9lfUE4a11DAwksbw2xPEvzhDfWd6yo
See pastebin for instructions on how to install or update your pack without causing the game to fail to recognize which tracks you have installed.

>How do I play?
Anon guide will be posted, there's 3 parts covering most basics.
Try to practice airbraking and things for a little bit using the Campaign's practice mode before jumping right in otherwise you'll probably have a hard time.
We can also answer any questions you might have, either here or within the lobby.

>I'm bad and not going to win!
Once you get above the skill floor anyone can win races due to their chaotic nature.
Also we always get newfriends who will match your skill level.

We also have a steam group: https://steamcommunity.com/groups/ballisticnv
This is used just for organizing race sessions, no circlejerking.

name: Anonymous
com:
Are you an elder Millennial or Gen Xer who has fond memories of the greatest MMO ever made? Did you know that there is a thriving AC emu community with multiple servers? Well, there is and the latest addition to the emu server stable is the best one yet. Dekarutide is a reimagining of classic (pre-Throne of Destiny) AC that makes the game far more challenging and - in many players' opinions - fun.
>Daily patches & updates by Dekaru himself, he has worked on this project for years before finally releasing it to the public.
>Lootgen gems are infinite use, cast buffs on you & can be replenished with mana charges
>Jewelry can now have attributes on it
>Many older quest rewards made relevant
>No cottages/villas/mansions, just apartments and theyre all linked together
>12 pack slots in apts
>No item/creature magic
>No weeping/hollow/etc, you can find lootgen slayers and other properties from mobs and vendors
>New skills
>Skill and Damage formulae completely redone
>New Ley Line Amulets - you buy Life and War Magic amulets from an archmage and find a Menhir ring (stone formation) in dereth (there's 10-20 of them) and you can meditate in the Menhir ring formation and imbue the amulet with a random property that passively buffs your character with either increased damage or increased effect of some sort of skill. These amulets are attuned/bonded and fit in the cloak slot
>New aiming system
>Aim high: Chance of doing more damage
>Aim medium: Chance of target evasion lowered
>Aim low: Chance of you evading target increased

name: Anonymous
sub: /LFG/ - Small MMORPG looking for group general
com:
Do you play an MMORPG (or private server) that is generally too small to level with other people either because everyone else is at level cap, group leveling is considered outdated, or because there is just not enough people to form groups for group content? Is there an MMORPG or private server that you would play if there were people to level with? Or maybe you're looking for a new MMORPG (or private server) to play with some people.

This is not a thread to find people to play popular MMORPGs with (Guild Wars 2, World of Warcraft or its more popular private servers, New World, Lost Ark, FFXIV, CoH Homecoming, Return of Reckoning, etc). This is for the dead, dying, or just very small MMORPGs (or at least the ones in which it is a struggle or impossible to find people for group content while leveling) such as EverQuest I and II, LotRO, DDO, Asheron's Call, Age of Conan, and small private servers. As ultimately I do not know which ones exactly are hard to find groups for, this is up to your discretion and is ultimately a thread guideline.

Only advertise here if you are serious about helping form a leveling group or even a community (such as a guild) on your game. Coordinate with people on times (if a group) or simply a server and faction/realm (if a guild/community).

Solo Dungeons close after 90 seconds now. They are relatively safe and give poor rewards because of it. They are no longer the best content in the game. Safe solo content is by far the worst. Do safe Hellgates if you hate risk but still want decent rewards.
CDs (Slayer) are okay but most of the silver comes from PvP. Okay rewards but very low fame.
Go buy yourself a 4.0 Nature Staff and farm T5/T6 blackzones. You can probably do it in T3 gear. It's the best silver and fame you can get by yourself. Who cares about losing 30k? You make much in silver drops from 10 mobs alone.
Go into solo mists. The new mobs drop artifacts that sell for millions right now because the suppy is so low.

last_replies.name: Anonymous

>>768795
Which nature staff? And what should I farm in T5/6 BZ? world map mobs and those open camps?

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>768934
Simply pick the first one that's also available at T3 if you are not sure. Besides the E skills they are all identical. One handed weapons deal a little less damage but you can wear an off-hand. Nature Staff + Torch is great and cheap. You really can't do anything wrong here.
Kill the mobs that you see in the open world. Mount up and walk away when you see players. Journey Home whenever you carry more than you are willing to lose.
Get a few zones away from the city so less players bother you and you find more high tier mobs (they upgrade over time).
